Tucson holds his cross bow at the ready.  Whatever it was that was in that =
base, he seemed quite ready to face it.  He narrows his eyes while he liste=
ns to the hums and buzzing of the controls which Guardia had used to open t=
he door.  

"If there are any hostiles here, I'll make sure they don't get =
very far. I like a good challenge.  It's been a while since I had one."

He=
 uses his audio sensors to sweep the room.  Something faint catches his son=
ar system, and he freezes, aiming his cross bow toward the source of the so=
und.  The CR chambers.  Once he realized what his sonar data revealed, he l=
owers the weapon and walks toward one of the CR chambers, placing a hand on=
 it.

" It's warm.  It's functioning.  Guardia, over here, I need you to lo=
ok inside this CR chamber for me.  See if you see anyone inside or if it's =
vacant. "

Frustration trickles in slightly as Tucson realizes that before =
he lost his sight he could do anything anyone requested him to do.  But now=
 that was not the case.  There were just a few situations where a pair of e=
yes was necesary and this was one of those situations.  It shows in his exp=
ression as he feels the chamber with his hand.
